text: I agree, it is mostly a net time-loss. But I get some satisfaction out of it and that makes it worth it in the end. After all, it may feel great that I know I have exactly the same configurations for all my tools on every box I control and nice to be able to override the package manager preferences where I need it (running Julia from NixOS/unstable while the rest is NixOS/stable for example), but I really would have to be one hell of a zealot to argue that it is something I would strongly recommend to everyone out there as “the true way”. =)
